That's a great plan! Twitter Analytics and Hashtagify will give you a good starting point to track your branded hashtag #WriteWithSarah on Twitter. Twitter Analytics will provide you with a more detailed look at your tweet-level performance, while Hashtagify will offer insights into the broader hashtag ecosystem.

LinkedIn Analytics will also give you a good understanding of how your hashtag is performing on the platform.

Remember to set up your Twitter Analytics and Hashtagify accounts, and start tracking your hashtag performance regularly. You can also set up custom dashboards or reports to make it easier to monitor your progress.

Some tips to keep in mind:

* Start tracking your hashtag performance regularly to get a baseline understanding of your metrics.
* Experiment with different types of content, hashtags, and posting schedules to see what resonates with your audience.
* Use the insights you gather to refine your content strategy and adjust your hashtag usage accordingly.
* Don't be afraid to try new things and pivot if you're not seeing the results you want.

By tracking your branded hashtag, you'll be able to:

* Understand your audience better
* Refine your content strategy
* Increase engagement and brand awareness
* Identify opportunities for growth and improvement

If you have any questions or need help setting up your analytics tools, feel free to ask. I'm here to help!

How often do you plan to track your hashtag performance, and what specific metrics are you most interested in monitoring?
